meanings.definition: The quality or state of being contrary or obstinate in behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her perverseness in always wanting the opposite made it challenging to agree on anything.
meanings.sent2: His perverseness in refusing to follow instructions led to constant conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The perverseness of the cat in only wanting to play at midnight kept the whole household awake.
meanings.sent4: The perverseness of the weather, changing from sunny to stormy in minutes, caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent5: The perverseness of the maze, leading us in circles, frustrated our attempts to find the exit.

meanings.definition: The act of turning away from what is right or good; wickedness.
meanings.sent1: The perverseness of his actions, always choosing the dishonest path, eventually caught up with him.
meanings.sent2: She was shocked by the perverseness of the criminal's deeds, causing harm without remorse.
meanings.sent3: The perverseness of the situation, where good was punished and evil rewarded, seemed like a twisted tale.
meanings.sent4: The perverseness of the storm, destroying everything in its path, left a trail of devastation.
meanings.sent5: The perverseness of the villain, reveling in causing chaos, made him a formidable foe.
